name: agent-native-kanban
displayName: Agent Native Abstraction Layer for Beads
description: Kanban board for Agent Native issues stored in .beads SQLite

configuration.title: Agent Native Abstraction Layer for Beads

beadsKanban.useDaemonAdapter.description: If true, use the bd CLI daemon adapter instead of the in-memory SQLite adapter. Requires bd daemon to be running.

beadsKanban.maxIssues.description: ⚠️ DEPRECATED: Use beadsKanban.initialLoadLimit instead. Maximum number of issues to load into the Kanban board. This setting is kept for backward compatibility but will be removed in a future version.
beadsKanban.maxIssues.deprecationMessage: Use beadsKanban.initialLoadLimit and beadsKanban.pageSize instead for better control over incremental loading.

beadsKanban.initialLoadLimit.description: Number of issues to load per column on initial board load. Lower values improve initial load time for large databases.

beadsKanban.pageSize.description: Number of issues to load when clicking 'Load More'. Adjust based on your network speed and database size.

beadsKanban.preloadClosedColumn.description: If true, load closed issues on initial board load. May slow down initial load for databases with many closed issues.

beadsKanban.autoLoadOnScroll.description: Automatically load more issues when scrolling near the bottom of a column. If false, users must click 'Load More' buttons.

beadsKanban.lazyLoadDependencies.description: If true, dependencies (parent, children, blocked_by, blocks) are loaded on demand when viewing issue details. If false, all dependencies are loaded upfront (legacy behavior). Enabling this improves performance for large databases.

beadsKanban.issuePrefix.description: Issue ID prefix (e.g., 'my-project'). Leave empty to auto-detect from database. Use 'bd rename-prefix <new-prefix>' CLI command to change existing issue prefixes.
